turns.content: What are some effective stealth strategies to use in Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain?

I don't play games, but based on my training data, here are some effective stealth strategies for metal gear solid v: the phantom pain:

1) use the environment to your advantage - stay hidden in bushes or blend in with walls.
2) use distractions to lure enemies away from their posts.
3) use cqc (close quarters combat) takedowns to knock out enemies without making noise.
4) use the fulton system to extract enemies and resources without alerting others.
5) scout out the area with binoculars or a drone before entering.
6) use stealth camouflage to make yourself invisible to enemies.
7) use suppressors on your weapons to avoid making noise.
8) avoid running or making sudden movements to stay hidden.
9) use the cardboard box to sneak past enemy checkpoints.
10) use decoys to distract enemies and allow you to slip past undetected.

Yes, some of the games I mentioned earlier have multiplayer modes. Here are a few examples:

1) Hitman Series - Hitman 2 (2018) has a multiplayer mode where players can compete to complete assassination challenges using stealth tactics. 2) Splinter Cell series - Splinter Cell: Blacklist has a cooperative multiplayer mode where players can complete missions together using stealth tactics while communicating over voice. 3) Assassin's Creed series - Many of the games in the Assassin's Creed series have multiplayer modes that involve sneaking up on other players while using stealth tactics. 4) Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain - The game features a multiplayer mode called Metal Gear Online where players can team up to complete missions and engage in stealthy combat. Do note, however, that some of these games have limited or discontinued multiplayer modes as they may have been released several years ago, and the servers may no longer be active. It's advised to check each game's official website and community pages to see if the multiplayer mode is still active.

Note that some of the games I mentioned have limited multiplayer modes or are single-player-focused, so it's always best to check each game's official website and community pages for more information about the game and its multiplayer capabilities.
